name: AudioFocus
headline: Hearing aids that work in noisy places, like restaurants, using ML.
description:
If we've learned anything in the last few years it's that spending time with our friends and family is essential to our well-being and happiness. Unfortunately, loud and noisy places like weddings and family gatherings hinder human connection, especially for the hearing impaired. In fact, the biggest unmet need in the entire hearing healthcare industry is hearing in noisy places. AudioFocus helps patients hear in these environments by only enhancing voices nearby the patients and ignoring ones farther away. We do this using acoustics informed machine learning and custom microphone array design.

Our goal is to increase the adoption rate of 37M US adults with hearing loss, only 8M use hearing aids today.

Founded by Auditory Neuroscientist & AI expert and a Hearing Aid hardware design expert.

founders.name: Shariq Mobin, Founder
founders.description: Machine Learning and Distributed Systems hacker. Accessibility advocate.

# Hearing aids that work in noisy places
Unlike traditional hearing aids, AudioFocus amplifies only nearby and important voices. 
[Get in touch](http://audiofocus.io/</contact>)
[![play video](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/63bdfb892ba7e2990c436841_Screenshot%202023-01-10%20at%203.51.57%20PM.png)](http://audiofocus.io/<#>)
Supported by
![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/66555de75ac536a87f96d558_nia_logo.png)![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6358c17864ee6f2fa8b97d34_medicine-small-vertical-blue-500px-bfc92e0736.png)![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6354b6230af27d368fcf2c91_Y_Combinator_logo_text_wordmark.png)![Y Combinator](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6358c0eba9040f5b87186fad_HLAA-horiz-logo_4C.png)
# The Problem
### Traditional hearing aids amplify noise
They rely on one sound direction for noise reduction, but both conversation and noise come from many directions.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d170db028e235497b58c_navy%20bg%203%402x.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d0ca256a8d7c0e6c76d2_tech4%402x.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d170db028e235497b58c_navy%20bg%203%402x.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d32d5ee93e1d3d9db06b_tech5.png)
### Not all “machine learning” is the same
Machine Learning for hearing aids today works by enhancing speech and ignoring non-speech, but this doesn’t work in common situations like a noisy cafe, where you have ambient speech.
### Technology for the real world
AudioFocus reimagined the hearing aid — so you can follow conversations wherever you go. Our patented technology uses a proprietary machine learning algorithm that only amplifies voices nearby by analyzing echo statistics, just like our brains do.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d170db028e235497b58c_navy%20bg%203%402x.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d261d7638ba002afe582_tech6.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355d2588d90519adfdfc9d7_tech1.png)
> Use ML to auto-detect which voices are important in the presence of many.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355cad7f9e1cc4800d9b8e5_tech2.png)
> Design a microphone array that maximizes the sound clarity and noise reduction benefits.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355cad79ee2d11eb0198fd9_tech3.png)
> Utilize lower power AI Processors that allow for a discreet and ergonomic design.
[Learn more](http://audiofocus.io/</technology>)
TESTIMONIALS
## Expert Opinions
Clearly the noise reduction is strong and focus is strong which is exactly what people always talk about wanting. I look forward to collaborating with AudioFocus on the impact of their technology.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/63559c29afc1661c0706032f_Nicholas%20R.png)
**Professor Nicholas Reed, AuD, PhD**
Director of Audiology, Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg School of Public Health 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/660154a2c48a52529530d2b3_Dr.Reed.Uni.Logo.svg)
AudioFocus has a unique approach, it has the potential to be one of the most innovative hearing technologies in recent decades and become a true market disruptor.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/660153235c54109ea5cb0bd5_Joe_Hu_AuD__2024-768x768.jpeg)
**Professor Jiong “Joe” Hu, AuD, PhD**
Vice Chair of AudiologyUniversity of the Pacific, San Francisco
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/660155b8271dacdf10520cb3_Joe_University_Logo.png)
I had the opportunity to try the AudioFocus prototype, and I believe this is an innovative approach that has the potential to address the most common complaint of individuals with hearing loss, which is understanding speech in noise.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/66015f1bc282202f529c76c7_Fitzgerald.jpg)
**Professor Matthew Fitzgerald, PhD**
Chief of Audiology,Stanford University School of Medicine
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/66015f375c13e634f9cb3bc8_Fitzgerald.Univ.Logo.png)
The sound separation is absolutely amazing, I can barely hear the other voices. I wish my AirPods did this.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/65f411f1b6d11111a365b6b3_Dan%20O%E2%80%99Mara.jpg)
**Dan O’Mara**
Founder and COO of MechLabs
This is amazing, I feel so at peace. I would say that I’m way more likely to engage in a conversation with this tech.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/660153230493893382ad270c_zubana.ali.jpeg)
**Zubana Ali**
Hearing Loss Patient & Medical Specialist
This is really good. Yes, I would definitely use it. I'd be interested in learning more. Thanks for sharing this.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/66015f1c51e3599d3acc0a7f_Craig.png)
**Craig Saltiel**
Hearing Loss Patient
## Our approach
Every aspect of the AudioFocus will serve unmet needs around hearing loss.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355dea9d7638b102cb043cb_care.svg)
##### Care First
Clinically, a person might have ‘normal’ hearing but they can’t hear in background noise. That person deserves care too.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/66554abdd2b62566d03b3e1b_Screen%20Shot%202024-05-27%20at%208.08.17%20PM.png)
##### Control
Accessibility tech should offer easily available controls that allow users to tune their experiences, whether it be volume, scale of noise reduction, or something else.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/635186033791a35468a94c68/6355deaad7638b535ab043cc_privacy.svg)
##### Privacy
Our data augmentation technology allows us to help people hear in a variety of situations without data farming from them.
Subscribe for updates

generated_description:
Let's talk about AudioFocus, a company tackling one of the most pervasive challenges in hearing healthcare: noise. Founded in 2019 and based in Oakland, CA, AudioFocus emerged from a deep understanding of how vital it is for people, especially those with hearing loss, to connect in lively environments—think family gatherings or bustling cafes. Unfortunately, traditional hearing aids often amplify not just the voices we want to hear but also the surrounding noise, making these situations even more frustrating.

The founders—a blend of auditory neuroscience and AI expertise—have developed a smart, machine-learning-powered solution that focuses solely on enhancing nearby voices while filtering out the rest. In essence, they’re bending sound to the user’s will, allowing them to engage in conversations even amid the chaos of background noise.

Their technology is a game-changer because it uses advanced algorithms and custom microphone arrays to analyze sound in real-time, mimicking how our brains filter out unwanted noise. This approach distinguishes them from existing hearing aids, which struggle in environments where multiple conversations happen simultaneously. By only amplifying critical voices based on their proximity, AudioFocus enables users to navigate social situations with ease and clarity.

AudioFocus is on a mission to address a considerable gap in the market—of the 37 million adults in the U.S. who have hearing loss, a mere 8 million use existing hearing aids. This shows there's a world of unmet needs out there, and AudioFocus is building a bridge to reach it. 

Currently, they’re a small team of four and are part of Y Combinator’s Batch S19, reflecting their potential for innovation and growth. They're tagged as focusing on deep learning, hardware, medical devices, and they have the technical chops to make a real impact.

If you’re curious to know more or get involved, check out their website at [audiofocus.io](http://audiofocus.io). Their work promises to transform how people with hearing loss experience life’s important moments. In a world that's loud and busy, we could all benefit from focusing on the voices that matter most.
